intro: Pimpinella fauriei, commonly known as the Faurie's cowparsley, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. It is a biennial or perennial herb that typically grows in moist, temperate regions. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, white or yellowish flowers. It is often found in meadows, woodlands, and along stream banks. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, contributing to its distribution across various habitats.
